title: Substance Abuse Counselor
description:
***Full time, Part time and per diem positions available!*** 

SCO Family of Services is currently seeking compassionate Primary Counselors/CASACs to join our team in our Madonna Heights Morning Star programs. Our Morning Star programs allow mothers in recovery from substance and alcohol abuse, to live and bond with their children at our residence located in Dix Hills, NY. The position of Primary Counselor/CASAC is providing services as well as developing and enforcing recovery plans for our residents.

**As a Primary Counselor you will:**

* Understand the program’s policies, routines and regulations
* Conduct phone screens, intake interviews and assessments with prospective clients.
* Complete LOCADTR.
* Participate in comprehensive service planning for each assigned resident in collaboration with other agencies.
* Collaboratively develop individualize recovery plans and monthly updates with each assigned resident.
* Oversee identified tasks from recovery plans and updates are followed through.
* Interpret and enforce the policies, procedures, rules and regulations at all times in a consistent manner and in keeping with their intent regarding the delivery of services to the residents in care.
* Remain alert to problem identification and crisis resolution as required.
* Attend in-service training sessions, conferences and/or workshops as required and authorized by the Program Director.
* Participate in weekly staff meetings and supervision with Program Supervisor.
* Maintain a safe and comfortable environment for the residents.
* Conduct scheduled group meetings with residents.
* Drive clients to meetings, treatment, etc., if needed.
* Observe and record residents’ medication usage.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Ideal Candidates must possess:**

* **CASAC/CASAC-T Required**
* Clean and valid driver’s license
* Experience working with individuals in the substance and alcohol abuse arena
* A strong belief in others ability to grow and change

**Benefits include:**

Medical insurance, Vision and Dental (for FT staff), 100% agency paid life insurance, 403B retirement plan, generous PTO package, paid training, tuition reimbursement, discounts on phone services & more!!

***SCO Family of Services is an equal employment opportunity employer.***

Work Remotely

title: Refrigeration Maintenance Manager
description:
**Job Summary**

The Refrigeration Manager of Maintenance is responsible for overseeing our Facility and HVAC Technicians. The manager will be responsible for all regulatory upkeep and scheduled maintenance keeping us compliant while assisting in overseeing contracts of third party vendors.

Minimum Qualifications: Experience in High Tension Electric, Refrigeration, General Facility Maintenance, High Pressure Steam Boilers, HVAC, and air compressor systems.

Responsibilities:

* Assigning tasks to technicians and following up on completions.
* Maintain and update preventative maintenance schedules.
* Work with other departments to plan maintenance projects.
* Budgeting of maintenance spend on parts, labor, and services
* Labor scheduling and planning.
* Working with external contractors.

Education and Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s in engineering
* Proficient in outlook, excel, Building Management Systems, and ServiceDesk
* Refrigeration License
* High Pressure Boiler License (preferred not needed)
* Holder of Certificate of fitness S95 S12 S13 G92 F60 G60 F01 Q99 B27
* Professionalism when dealing with technicians, vendors, and employees.
* Time Management
* Attention to Detail
* Organizational Skills
* Must embody and demonstrate company values and culture.

**Who is FreshDirect:**

In 2023, FreshDirect officially become a part of the Getir family! This strategic partnership combines FreshDirect's diverse product portfolio and expansive customer base with Getir's renowned expertise in ultrafast grocery delivery and cutting-edge technology.

Getir, well-known for its lightning-fast grocery delivery services, is set to enhance FreshDirect's infrastructure with its technological prowess. By leveraging Getir's rapid delivery approach, FreshDirect aims to redefine the future of grocery delivery in the United States.

**Why choose FreshDirect?**

We're a company that thrives on teamwork. Our evolution is driven by our passionate employees and investment in perfecting the technology that lets us deliver the highest-quality food. Our state-of-the-art facility creates an environment for innovation. We support our employees with on-the-job training for plant employees and drivers, team-building activities, workplace recognition opportunities, and by encouraging direct relationships with our suppliers in the field.

Great people deserve great perks. We offer comprehensive benefits, plus many workplace extras, including:

* A flexible and generous paid time off plan
* 20% off at freshdirect.com and significant markdowns at our employee market
* 24-hour access to the FreshDirect shuttle between our Bronx headquarters and the subway
* Regular events and barbecues for employees

Click to explore careers and life @ FreshDirect

Learn more @FreshDirect on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube!

title: NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director
description:
**Title:** NYS Workers Compensation Group Self Insured Director

**Rate of Pay:** $288,052.67 (Weekly: $5,230.76 + $201.02 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Full-time, Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department:** Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP)

**Location:** Flushing/Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**Shift:** Full Time Onsite 35 Hours per Week - Monday – Friday 8:30-4:30, must be available for emergencies evenings and weekend via phone.

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

The Electrical Employers Self Insurance Safety Plan (EESISP) is the largest and oldest group self-insured trust fund in New York State. For over 50 years, it has provided workers’ compensation and disability coverage to the members of Local Union No. 3, IBEW and affiliated employers. Since its inception, EESISP has paid over $1 billion in indemnity benefits and medical costs related to on the job injuries. In 1996, EESISP created a model Alternate Dispute Resolution and managed care program for workers’ compensation in New York.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a professional office -- customer service environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as desktop computers, phone, scanner, printer, keyboard, photocopiers, shredder, and fax.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Travel** -- No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Thorough working knowledge of NYS Workers Compensation Law & Disability Law
* Minimum of 15-20 years experience in the field
* Must have Insurance Industry managerial experience
* Experience managing a staff of 20 employees
* Experience in: Claims handling and supervision of claims examiners; Setting Reserves; Financial Management; Interacting with auditors, actuaries, accountants and attorneys; Setting goals and managing a team to accomplish those goals; Reporting to the Board of Directors
* Ability to interact with high level personnel at NYS WCB in Albany
* Familiarity with ADR programs and working in a Union environment helpful
* Other duties as assigned

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**HIPAA Compliance Required**

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Full-Time Benefits Package:**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K without mandatory matching, vested immediately before FICA gross reimbursement.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date-Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, no employee premium coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, DDS/Empire Dental, in addition eligible employee may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* NYS Paid Family Leave
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Two Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.

title: Workers Compensation Claims Associate
description:
**Job Title:** Claims Associate (Workers Compensation)

**Rate of Pay:** $67,780.57 ($1,203.76 weekly+ $99.71 weekly FICA reimbursement)

**Department:** EESISP

**Location:** On-site Fresh Meadows, NY

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Reporting to the Supervisor, under close supervision, the Claims Associate ‘B’ Grade 8 will perform various duties including but not limited to:

* Review of electrical industry workers' compensation claims and determine compensability.
* File all required workers compensation forms timely.
* Oversee medical management and investigations of claims.
* Calculate payroll and compensation payments based on set guidelines.
* Serve as liaison and interface with Magna Comp nurse and claimant as part of the review process.
* Assign cases for investigations and review progress.
* Prepare workers compensation claims for long-term disability.
* Ability to evaluate the degree of disability and scheduled loss value.
* Maintains a professional relationship with all appropriate parties involved with the claim.
* Refers cases as appropriate to management.
* Actively executes appropriate claims activities to ensure consistent delivery of quality claims service.
* Develops and manages claims through well-developed action plans; continues to work on the action plan to bring the claim to an appropriate and timely resolution.
* Analyzes and processes workers’ compensation claims by investigating and gathering information to determine the exposure on the claim.
* Communicate with Local 3 Business representatives regarding claims management.
* Perform other duties and special assignments as necessary.

**Work Environment**

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30 PM.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**

No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* A four-year college degree required.
* A minimum of 3 years of experience as a workers’ compensation examiner required.
* Extensive knowledge of NYS Disability and Worker’s Compensation laws.
* Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Word & Excel.
* Must be able to work independently and collectively.
* Familiarity with claim reserve.
* Must possess the ability to make sound judgments.
* Strict confidentiality.

**Other Duties/Special Projects**

title: Bilingual Case Manager
description:
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES** (include but are not limited to):

· Interview program participants.

· Develop relationships with participants while maintaining PROFESSIONAL and APPROPRIATE boundaries.

· Provide casework and counseling referral to participants.

· Participate in staff meetings and in the screening process for prospective residents.

· Provide appropriate advocacy and referrals for clients seeking housing, legal advice, etc., while encouraging and facilitating clients’ independent action.

· Maintain up-to-date records of all activities and submit weekly reports to supervisory staff.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Ability to communicate orally in the English language or other language as may be specified, with clients, agencies, the public and in group and face-to-face, one-on-one settings.

Ability to work cooperatively with other employees, clients, and the public.

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of situations where only limited information exists.

The employee in this position is often required to lift up to 25lbs., stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, use fingers, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.

Individuals must be physically capable of operating the vehicles safely, possess a valid driver's license, must have use of an insured vehicle, and have a satisfactory driving record. Successful background, driving record, and criminal record clearances required at hire and/or at random in the future.

Employment, educational and credentialing validation also required at hire.

**Education/Experience:**

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of situations where only limited information exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, or schedule formats.

Strong computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office Suite.

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

title: Facilities Maintenance Technician
description:
The Creek is a family country club founded in 1923. We are looking for a dedicated Facilities Maintenance Technician to join our team and help us ensure our buildings and systems are operating smoothly.

**Position Overview:**  
As a Facilities Maintenance Technician, you will be essential in maintaining and repairing our buildings, equipment, and systems. Under the guidance of the Facilities Director, you will handle a variety of tasks, from electrical and plumbing repairs to general upkeep and preventative maintenance. If you are detail-oriented, personable, and responsive, we want to hear from you!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Electrical Maintenance:** Replace and repair 110v receptacles, switches, fluorescent ballasts, light bulbs, and fixtures.
* **Plumbing Repairs:** Fix flushometers, replace faucet washers, and unclog drains, toilets, and urinals. Investigate and address leaks.
* **HVAC Maintenance:** Clean and replace filters in air conditioning units and perform preventive maintenance.
* **General Maintenance:** Lubricate equipment, change filters, assist with belt replacements, and repair or replace ceiling tiles, base molding, and floor tiles.
* **Tool and Equipment Care:** Keep tools and equipment clean and in good working condition.
* **Additional Duties:** Painting, sheet rock installation and repair when necessary.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Two years of prior experience as a maintenance mechanic or helper is preferred.

**Skills and Attributes:**

* Strong communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization.
* Friendly and professional demeanor, with a commitment to responsive and efficient service.

**Why Join Us?**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Supportive team environment.

If you are a proactive, skilled individual with a passion for maintaining high standards, we encourage you to apply. Join us in making The Creek a place where everything runs smoothly!

title: Assistant Teacher
description:
**Assistant Teacher**

Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York, here to create hope, restore dignity and connect families with the resources to get back on track.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

**\\*\\*Effective May 1st, 2024 – May 31st, 2024, we will be offering a sign on bonus of $1,000 to all Lead Teachers and $500 to all Assistant Teachers who apply within the specified window of time.**

**This sign on bonus will align with FSW’s outlined procedure, as well as be agreed upon between both the applicant and HR upon time of hire.\\*\\***

**Job Details:**

Family Services of Westchester is looking for **full-time Assistant Teachers** for our Prime Time program. We are hiring for multiple locations throughout Westchester County.

**POSITION TITLE**: Assistant Teacher  
**SALARY:** *$17/hour*  
**STATUS**: Permanent/Full Time  
**SUPERVISED BY**: Head Teacher  
**PURPOSE**: To assist and support the Head Teacher to interpret and implement the Prime-Time program to address the needs of each individual child.  
**WORK LOCATION:** One Location

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**:

* Ensure health and safety guidelines for children.
* Assist lead teacher in the documentation, reflection and planning process to implement the curriculum.
* Attend staff training to support professional development.
* Build relationships with families and communicate about children's learning and development.
* Assist with creating a warm and inclusive environment for children and families.
* Assist with creating visual evidence of the narratives and curriculum occurring in your classroom.
* Other tasks as assigned by supervisor and Head Teacher.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**:

* CDA or Associate’s Degree in Early Childhood Education or related field, English fluency.

**PERFORMANCE CRITERIA**: Performance will be evaluated based on:

* Continuing to pursue education in the Early Childhood field.
* Performance and Goals
* Seniority.

**Ability to Commute/Relocate:**

* White Plains, NY 10603: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

**Experience**:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

**Bonus opportunities for eligible Lead Teachers and Assistant Teachers, based on performance and employment status**

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Assistant Teacher speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please submit your resume and cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*FSW is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.75 - $17.28 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Medical Assistant - FT
description:
Description:
**Advanced Dermatology, P.C. is seeking an experienced Medical Assistant to come on board Full Time in our Fordham-Bronx office!**

**\\*Bilingual preferred\\***

**Position Summary**  

The Medical Assistant provides administrative and clinical support to licensed medical providers, as allowable by  

law, to ensure appropriate patient care and efficient office operations. A Certified (Registered) Medical Assistant  

supports providers and patients by handling various patient-care tasks related to management, organization, and  

communication. The position requires accuracy, quality work, compassion, and timeliness, while attending to  

patient needs.

**Key Roles & Responsibilities**  

* Prepares patients for the visit by directing and/or accompanying them to the examination room; providing


examination gowns and drape; helping them position themselves for the examination and/or treatment;  

monitoring instruments, supplies, and equipment.  

* Verifies patient information by interviewing patient; reviewing and/or recording medical history; taking vital


signs; confirming purpose of visit or treatment.  

* Supports patient-care by helping providers during examinations; preparing specimens; performing basic


laboratory tests on site; disposing of contaminated supplies; sterilizing medical instruments; authorizing drug  

refills as directed; calling in prescriptions to pharmacies; removing sutures; changing dressings.  

* Enters patients' vital statistics and information such as medications, test results, radiology, and laboratory


orders into the Electronic Health Record. (EMA)  

* Updates and files medical records and insurance reports
* Assists during medical examinations, as allowable by law
* Maintains patient confidence and protects operations by keeping patient information confidential
* Performs general office duties (e.g., answering telephones, taking dictation, and completing insurance forms)
* Schedules follow up appointment if indicated by provider
* Completes required administrative tasks, reporting and recordkeeping entries at end of each day
* Returns patient calls by the end of the day
* Other duties as assigned

Requirements:
* High school diploma or equivalent; some college preferred
* Medical assistant certification (CMA / RMA)
* 1+ year of experience working as a medical assistant (dermatology experience strongly preferred)
* Knowledge of medical terminology
* Excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Friendly and compassionate disposition with strong interpersonal communication skills
* Excellent time management skills and ability to maintain effective and organized systems to ensure timely


patient flow  

* Ability to work independently or as part of a team
* Dedication to maintaining confidentiality of all patient records

**EMA experience is a plus!**

**Benefits:**

**Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance**

**PTO**

**Paid Holidays**

**401K**

title: Stretch Technician, New York City
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE**


We are passionate about **high performance living** and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a **disruptive approach** to unleash it. We **dream big** and don’t settle for the status quo. We **sweat the details**. We never accept less than **110%** to **help each other** deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, **what’s next**. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture, and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value **humility** and a **team approach** at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others, then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description**  

Equinox is the industry leader for luxury fitness and health optimization. Our clubs are searching for experienced Fitness Professionals already certified in an array of related fields including Physical Therapy, Chiropractic Medicine, Yoga, Pilates, Personal Training, and/or Massage Therapy. Equinox’s Stretch + Mobility Training Program ensures that clients receive a hyper-customized stretching session.


Stretch Business Management

* Build and maintain an active client base
* Manage and maintain an accurate schedule, inclusive of client appointments, meetings, and open availability within our internal scheduling systems
* Market and sell stretch series to members and clients through phone calls, (emails?) and in-person interactions and Stretch Events.
* Maintain knowledge of all club services, programs, and products


Service and Hospitality

* Execute intake, outtake and assisted stretches 30/60 min as well as 15/25 min complimentary services for members
* Interact with members to enhance their recovery and overall club experience
* Create and offer personalized programs / series
* Maintain an organized, clean and safe stretch area during shifts and sessions


Professional Development

* Attend and pass mandatory pre-work training
* Continuing Education classes to elevate knowledge and qualify for promotions
* Attend and participate in any required one-on-one or team meetings with management

  

**Qualifications**  

Equinox’s Stretch + Mobility Training Program is an assisted stretching program developed by Equinox's most experienced manual therapists and experts. During the required Equinox proprietary theory and hands-on training, our Stretch + Mobility Specialists learn the muscular system, a variety of assisted stretches and how to work with a variety of clients from professional athletes, weekend warriors, those recovering from an injury and clients of all ages and body types.

* CPR/AED Certification
* Possess passion, ambition, drive, and knowledge regarding anatomy, fitness and recovery
* Ability to work in-person during weekdays/weekends
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Effective time management and organizational skills
* Basic computer and technology skills
* Energetic, friendly, punctual, hygienic and respectful

*Pay Transparency: $16-52 Hourly*

 **Additional Information** **AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:**

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop


NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: RN Director of Hospice
description:
**Hospice Director of Operations, Registered Nurse**

Are you a highly skilled and compassionate healthcare professional looking for a rewarding career in hospice as a Director of Operations? If so, we invite you to join our team at Amedisys, one of the largest and most trusted home health and hospice companies in the U.S.

**\\*Hospice experience strongly preferred\\***

Enjoy great perks and benefits

* A full benefits package with choice of affordable PPO or HSA medical plans.
* Paid time off.
* Up to $1,300 in free healthcare services paid by Amedisys yearly, when enrolled in an Amedisys HSA medical plan.
* Up to $500 in wellness rewards for completing activities during the year. Use these rewards to support your wellbeing with spa/massage/salon services, gym memberships, fitness classes, sports, hobbies, pets and more. \\*
* Mental health support, including up to five free counseling sessions per year through the Amedisys Employee Assistance program.
* 401(k) with a company match.
* Family support with infertility treatment coverage\\*, adoption reimbursement, paid parental and family caregiver leave.
* Fleet vehicle program\\*\\* and mileage reimbursement.
* And more.

*Please note: Benefit eligibility can vary by position depending on shift status.\\*To participate, you must be enrolled in an Amedisys medical plan.\\*\\*For full-time caregivers meeting certain requirements.*

What's in it for you

* Community-based care centers with a supportive and inclusive work environment.
* Better work/life balance and increased flexibility compared to other settings.
* Job stability and the opportunity to advance with a growing company.
* The opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of patients and their families providing much needed care where they want to be - in their homes.

Don't just take it from us - see what our caregivers love about Amedisys  
*"I have worked here just shy of a year and it's the best job I've ever had! We have an awesome team and administration is very supportive. I never felt so appreciated. Your time off is really yours."* - Amedisys caregiver

Why Amedisys  
Amedisys is a leading provider of home health, hospice and high-acuity care, dedicated to helping patients and families navigate the complex healthcare system. With a focus on compassionate, patient-centered care, you would be joining a team of professionals committed to improving the lives of those they serve.

Duties

* Responsible for overall organizational and financial management of the care center, and direction of care center operations and functions according to approved policies, procedures, and standards.
* Ensures the enhancement of business development and continuous improvement of care center efficiency and fiscal success.
* Provides supervision to the clinical manager(s) who ensure the delivery of quality care to patients.
* Provides input, guidance and feedback related to marketing activities and care center marketing plan to ensure that goals for growth are met.
* Coaches, directs and encourages staff.
* Ensures implementation of a performance improvement program to drive quality care, positive patient outcomes and address negative trends.
* Ensures issues and deficiencies identified during internal or external surveys or audits are addressed and corrected.
* Remains available to the care center at all times, in person or by phone.
* Responsible for employment decisions for direct report staff, including decisions to hire, fire, advance, promote or change status.
* Other duties as assigned.
* Associates degree in business or clinical related field.
* Two years hospice experience and at least one year of supervisory experience, or two years experience in leadership/management in healthcare or hospice.

Requirements

* Associates degree in nursing or clinical related field.
* Two years hospice RN experience and at least one year of supervisory experience, or two years experience in leadership/management in healthcare or hospice.

Preferred

* Bachelor's degree in nursing or clinical related field and licensed clinical professional.
* Current, unencumbered license to practice as an RN or other health care professional specific to that state you are assigned to work.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets and may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

*Amedisys is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified employees and applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military status, sexual orientation, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected characteristic.*

title: Front Desk Agent
description:
Description:

Our team is looking to add an upbeat **Front Desk Agent** to manage all aspects of front desk operations and be a key person of reference for our guests and vendors. To be successful in this role, you will need to extend professionalism and courtesy, have outstanding communication skills, and have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

***This position may require flexible scheduling availability.***


Requirements:
**Job Requirements:**

* Check-in/Check-out hotel guests
* Process all payments according to established hotel requirements
* Provide information and assistance to all guests and vendors
* Prepares all necessary reports during each shift for the management team

**Job Qualifications:**

* Highly motivated team player with strong initiative and desire for achievement
* Must be effective in handling problems in the workplace including anticipating, preventing, identifying, and solving problems as necessary
* Ability to work well in stressful situations
* Readily available and approachable for all guests while providing excellent guest service

***The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, sit or walk for an extended period of time. The number of hours you will be scheduled to work during the week is variable and is based on guest occupancy, season, staffing and other factors. Island Hospitality is unable to guarantee a specific number of work hours per week.***

**Training:**


Island Hospitality is committed to employee development and displays that commitment with a formalized training and development program providing a clear path for any employee with a desire and aptitude to thrive in the hospitality business. As team members join Island Hospitality from other organizations they too can build on that prior experience and find further growth opportunities within our company by utilizing the tools and resources offered.

**Team Member Wellness Program:** *How We Thank You For All You Bring To The Team*

**Rewarding Benefits Package:**

* Healthcare including Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* HSA & FSA plans available!
* Dependent care FSA
* Identity Theft Protection Insurance Commuter benefits including transit & parking
* Pet Insurance
* PTO and Payroll Incentives for Annual Wellness Exams
* Employee Assistance Program

* Paid Sick and Vacation Time
* Family Leave
* 401(k) Retirement plan - IHM Matches 100% up to 3% of your salary and an extra 50% on the next 2% of your salary. 401(k) is fully vested upon the first contribution

**Rewarding Hard Work:**

* Incentive based bonus program
* Free room nights at our hotels and employee discounts within your hotel brand
* Discounts for friends and family within your hotel brand
* Team Member of the Month, Quarter, and Year recognition and bonus
* Discounted tickets to theme parks, musicals, movies, and more through Tickets at Work
* Career Growth through our in-house training program with a path personalized to your desired goals
* Referral bonus program to ANY of our locations

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

*Island Hospitality uses E-Verify to confirm work authorization in all municipalities where it is required by law.*

title: Before and/or After School Program Staff
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is not just another childcare provider. We are Inc. 5,000's fastest-growing provider of Early Learning, Before and After School, and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations and growing. We are a certified benefit corporation on a mission to reinvent accessible and affordable childcare for today’s families and create opportunities for our team to do what they love (and feel valued while doing it). Join our award-winning community and dive into a world of excitement, growth, and endless possibilities. Check out what it's like to work with us at https://www.healthykidsprograms.com/workwithus.

**We are hiring for multiple positions for our Before and/or After School Program for the 2024-25 school year at Roaring Brook School, Chappaqua, NY.**

**JOB STATUS:** Part-time, non-exempt

**POSITIONS AVAILABLE:** Substitutes, Assistants, Group Leaders, Supervisors, Directors

**PAY:** $17-$18 per hour (based on role, qualifications, and experience)

**The Before and After-School Program team is responsible for:**

* Facilitating hands-on activities following the Healthy Kids Curriculum which includes fitness, STEAM, academic, art, and other group activities as well as homework completion.
* Providing a safe, healthy, and fun environment and acting as a positive role model for children in the program.
* Communicating daily with parents and family members via the Playground App.
* Observing state guidelines, Healthy Kids Extended Day Program policies, and host school policies.
* *Certain positions may also perform management functions such as accurate attendance records, registration, and staffing.*


Requirements:
**MINIUMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* You're 18 years or older and hold a High School Diploma or equivalent.
* While having 1 year of experience working with kiddos under 13 is awesome, it's not a must-have. We believe in potential and passion!
* Get ready to ace a background check, including fingerprinting, references, SEL & SCR through NYS Office of Children and Family Services.
* You've got the green light from your doctor - medically fit to rock all the job duties and free of any communicable diseases including TB.
* You’re warm, friendly, and upbeat. Exceptional people skills are your jam, whether it's with kiddos, parents, or fellow team members. Plus, you're professional, reliable, and always prompt.
* You're ready to bend, stretch, lift, carry (up to 50 lbs.), and do whatever it takes to keep up with kids!

**PART-TIME PERKS:**

* **On-Demand Pay:** Why wait for payday when you can have your money when you need it?
* **Telehealth Benefits:** Stay healthy and happy with access to virtual care
* **401(k) for eligible employees PLUS a 1% employer match:** Yep, we're serious about your future too!
* **Paid Sick Time Off:** Because everyone needs a break sometimes.
* **Career Development:** Level up your skills and expertise on us!
* **Growth Opportunities:** We’re growing and we need people to grow with us!
* **AFLAC Supplemental Plans:** Because we believe in going above and beyond to take care of our team.
* *Did we mention certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance?* Reach out to us for all the details!

*Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com*

title: Pre-Kindergarten Teacher
description:
Description:
**WHO WE ARE:** Healthy Kids is one of the North East’s largest providers of Early Learning, Before and After School and Summer Camp Programs with over 100 locations. We are reinventing accessible and affordable child care for today’s families and creating opportunities for caregivers to do what they love (and feel valued while they’re doing it). Join our community to provide the quality program children deserve while pursuing your own professional growth and development.

**We are currently looking for a Pre-Kindergarten Teacher for our classroom at Mamaroneck Union Free School District.**

**Status: Part-time, non-exempt**

**Pay: $25 - $28 per hour (based on qualifications and experience)**


The Pre-K program provides four-year-old children with a universal opportunity to access high-quality pre-kindergarten programs that prepare them for future school success. This position will require a high degree of creativity, cultural awareness and problem-solving capabilities. The program focuses on child-centered activities, development of strong foundational skills in early literacy and numeracy, social interactions and Kindergarten readiness skills. The successful candidate should possess experience with early literacy, multi-disciplinary approaches and strategies for meeting the needs of diverse learners.

**Responsibilities will always include but are not limited to:**

* Plan and implement a developmentally appropriate program for PreK students, meeting UPK School District requirements.
* Plan, prepare and teach well developed culturally responsive lessons.
* Assess, track, and provide relevant and timely feedback on the achievement and developmental needs of students.
* Use age-appropriate and positive guidance strategies to teach, encourage, and redirect inappropriate classroom behavior.
* Build relationships with staff and families through positive and professional communication, creating a welcoming environment, respecting diversity, and encouraging parent participation in the program.
* Work collaboratively with teacher assistants
* Design the room layout for success using ECERS (Early Childhood Environment Rating Scale)
* Developing activities that promote literacy and math concepts – following the Creative Curriculum
* Participating in on-going in-service and education development opportunities, and participating in the ongoing development and evaluation of the program’s goals and objectives


Requirements:
**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Current NYS teaching certificate valid for service in the early childhood grades
* Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred)
* Experience teaching preschool-age children

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


To be qualified as a Pre-K teacher, a person must possess either:


(a) New York State Certification Birth – Grade 2 OR


(b) New York State Certification N-6 OR


(c) New York State Certification P, K, 1-6 OR


(d) Bachelor’s Degree & 5-Year Plan

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Please note applicants for this position will be required to complete standard background screenings which include fingerprinting, NYS child abuse clearance, physical & TB test
* Must pass a full background check, including fingerprinting, references,
* Warm, friendly, caring, upbeat personality. Exceptional people skills in dealing with young children, parents and staff. Professional, reliable and prompt.
* Must have the stamina and physical flexibility (walking, sitting, standing, bending, kneeling, pulling, running, reaching, climbing, lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs.) without assistance to participate in children’s activities.

**BENEFITS:**


Telehealth Benefits


On Demand Pay


401(k) for eligible employees


Sick Time Off


Career Development


Certain applicants qualify for tuition assistance, get in touch for more details.


In addition, we offer competitive benefits for our full time employees including:


Paid Holidays


Health, Dental and Vision Insurance


Life Insurance


Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance


AFLAC Supplemental Plans


Healthy Kids is dedicated to creating a workforce that promotes and supports diversity and inclusion. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Healthy Kids Programs makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. For more information, visit: healthykidsprograms.com

title: Annuity Associate
description:
**Title:** Annuity Associate ‘B’ Grade 5 (OPEIU L153)

**Rate of Pay:** $57,097.93 (Weekly: $1,014.04 + $84.00 FICA Reimbursement)

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt

**Employer:** Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry

**Department**: Annuity

**Location:** 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr Ave, Fresh Meadows, NY 11365

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The annuity department is seeking an experienced Annuity Associate ‘B’ with excellent customer service skills. Under close supervision, reporting to Supervisor and Assistant Supervisor of Annuity, the Annuity Associate ‘B’ will be responsible for various duties, including but not limited to the following:

* Serve as the primary Customer Service Representative and screen all incoming calls.
* Processing all types of claims for the Annuity Fund, Additional Security Benefits Fund, Health Reimbursement Plan, Vacation, Holiday Unemployment Plan, and the Employer Portion of the Deferred Salary Plan.
* Reviewing and process the following documents accordingly, but not limited to:
* o Divorce papers, including Stipulations, Facts and Conclusions.
* o Power of Attorney papers.
* o Guardianship forms.
* o Adoption decree, certificate, Amended Birth Certificate, etc.
* o Documentation on name changes.
* Checks claims for account balance, proper documentation, and general eligibility. All claims are keyed in by the processor online.
* Accepting the daily check runs from IT, checking for errors and having checks signed to prepare. for mailing.
* Sorting and distributing mail for all areas of the Annuity Department.
* Handles all customer service calls (high volume) in addition to assisting members in reception area.
* May perform other related clerical duties.

**Work Environment** 

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt (OPEIU Local 153) position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday 8:30AM-4:30PM.

**Flexibility**: Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**: No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**

* Previous Paralegal or Legal Assistance experience preferred.
* Certified Notary Public Preferred.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Must have the ability to handle complex problems and multi-task.
* Demonstrable computer skills (Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Adobe).
* This is a high-volume position which requires attention to detail, speed, and accuracy.
* Must be comfortable working with numbers.
* Must adhere to a confidential code of ethics.
* Ability to work professionally and cooperatively with others.
* Must have experience working with legal documents.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**BENEFITS**

* 10% of employer contribution to your 401K (before FICA gross-up reimbursement) *without* mandatory matching, vested immediately before.
* Basic Pay + FICA reimbursement (Social Security and Medicare Tax reimbursed as weekly added to compensation) = total weekly compensation.
* After completing 26 weeks of full-time employment from permanent hire date: Free health, dental, and optical insurance - funded by the employer, NO employee premium. Coverage thru Magna Care PPO (Medical), Express Script for Prescription, and DDS/Empire Dental. In addition, eligible employees may use JIB Medical P.C.
* Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability.
* NYS Paid Family Leave.
* Jury Duty and Death in family bereavement days off.
* 11 Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Vacation
* Retirement plan – Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.
* Life Insurance

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.**

title: OB Scrub Technician
description:
**Job Title: O.R. Scrub Technician (Inpatient and Outpatient)**

**Location:** White Plains, New York  
**Employment Type:** Full Time  
**Experience Required:** 2 - 20 Years  
**Industry:** Nursing Support, Operating Room

**Position Summary**

Under the direction of the Nurse Manager or Registered Professional Nurse, the O.R. Scrub Technician is responsible for handling instruments, supplies, and equipment during surgical procedures. The technician must understand the procedure being performed and anticipate the needs of the surgeons, ensuring quality patient care throughout the operation. Maintaining sterile technique and assisting with post-procedure care are critical components of this role.

**Responsibilities**

* **Compliance:** Understands and adheres to WPH Performance Standards, Policies, and Behaviors.
* **Essential Functions:** Adheres to New York Public Health Law 2824 concerning surgical technology and technologists.
* **Nursing Procedures:** Performs nursing procedures as per WPH policy.
* **Preparation:** Checks supplies and equipment prior to surgical procedures.
* **Operative Assistance:** Scrubs, sets up, counts, and assists intra-operatively.
* **Sterile Technique:** Maintains the highest standard of sterile technique.
* **Post-Procedure Care:** Assists surgeons and RNs with post-procedure care.
* **Specimen Handling:** Appropriately handles specimens.
* **Instrument Preparation:** Prepares instruments for decontamination.
* **OR Case Preparation:** Assists with preparing and picking OR cases.
* **Safety Protocols:** Follows WPH policies for Infection Control and Fire Code.
* **Equipment Management:** Identifies malfunctioning equipment appropriately.
* **Patient Safety:** Follows patient safety standards.
* **Emergency Response:** Responds appropriately in emergency situations.
* **Competency:** Completes competency requirements.
* **Training:** Attends all mandatory in-services.
* **Cost Containment:** Utilizes cost containment practices.
* **Continuing Education:** Completes 15 hours of Continuing Education Credits as required by New York State Law.

**Education & Experience Requirements**

* **High School Diploma or GED required** and must meet one of the following:
* Graduate from a CAAHEP- or ABHES-accredited program and holds and maintains CST certification.
* Completed a military surgical technology program.
* Grandfathered as per applicable laws.
* In service of the federal government related to surgical technology duties.
* **BLS Certification:** Required as of April 1st, 2017 (through the American Heart Association).
* Hired before 4/1/17: Must receive BLS certification by 4/30/18.
* Hired on or after 4/1/17: Must receive BLS certification within 6 months of hire.

**Must-Have Skills**

* **Certification:** Certification by a nationally accredited surgical technologist credentialing organization.
* **Experience:** Prior experience as a Surgical Technologist preferred.
* **Nursing Procedures:** Proficient in performing nursing procedures per WPH policy.
* **Sterile Technique:** Maintains the highest standard of sterile technique.
* **Post-Procedure Care:** Assists surgeons and RNs with post-procedure care.

**Additional Guidelines**

* **Working Environment:** Operating Room
* **No Poach Clients:** Please ensure candidates are not sourced from the listed no-poach clients.
* **Strict No-Nos:**
* Exclude Travel Nurses from consideration.
* Seek candidates with longer job tenures.
* Offer salaries based on experience, performance, and time since acquiring licenses; avoid quoting the high end of the salary range.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 5x8
* 8 hour shift
* Night shift

Ability to Commute:

* White Plains, NY (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Dental Assistant
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Dental Assistant to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting our dental hygienists and dentists during patient care, ensuring the highest level of professionalism and patient satisfaction. The successful candidate will possess a strong understanding of dental assisting principles and have the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:

- Assist the dentist and hygienist during patient care, including preparing treatment rooms, taking X-rays, and sterilizing instruments.  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including medical histories, medications, and treatment plans.  
- Demonstrate a thorough understanding of dental anatomy and assist with procedures such as fillings, crowns, and extractions.  
- Provide pediatric care and work effectively with children of all ages.  
- Support endodontic procedures and maintain a clean and organized operatory environment.  
- Perform prosthodontic procedures, including dentures and partials.  
- Implement infection control measures to ensure a safe and clean environment for patients.  
- Utilize dental software and systems, including Epic, to manage patient information and update records.  
- Stay current with industry developments and maintain knowledge of dental assisting best practices.  
- Maintain a positive and supportive attitude, promoting a team-oriented environment.

Skills:

- Strong knowledge of dental assisting principles and procedures.  
- Proficiency in dental software and systems, including Epic.  
- Ability to maintain infection control measures and follow proper sterilization procedures.  
- Experience working with children and adults in a dental setting.  
- Familiarity with X-rays and radiology procedures.  
- Understanding of anatomy and dental anatomy.  
- Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing situations.  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Certification in dental assisting or willingness to obtain certification within a specific timeframe.

title: Full-time Medical Assistant (MA) Multiple Sites
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we are proud of our commitment to the Brooklyn, New York Community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients.

We are seeking a **Floating Medical Assistant** to join our supportive and encouraging team!

***NOTE***: This position requires accompanying an MD and traveling to other sites within Brooklyn.

**Responsibilities:**

* Helps patients by providing information, services, and assistance.
* Maintains medical supplies inventory and performs preventive maintenance to keep medical equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patients, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping with office procedures.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Schedules surgeries by making arrangements with the surgical center; verifying times with patients; and preparing charts and pre-admission and consent forms.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.
* Keep supplies ready by monitoring inventory stock, placing orders, and verifying receipts.
* Keeps up to date with industry best practice
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Medical Assistant Certification
* 2-3 years of experience in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology

* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.

title: House Manager
description:
**Dedicated. Compassionate. Inspiring. Rewarding.**

These are just some of the words to describe what it's like working at YCS. YCS employees are devoted professionals who have a passion for helping children, adolescents and adults.

**Do you share the same qualities?**

Davinchi Group Home located in Branchburg, NJ provides residential care for adults with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities in a group home setting. The program is currently hiring for a House Manager.

House Managers are expected to have a unique sensitivity to recognize and appropriately respond to clients who may have evidenced difficulties. Provide quality daily care (personal hygiene, housekeeping, meal preparation, and other related tasks) to ensure the health and safety of clients in the residence and community.

**Duties and Responsibilities Include:**

* To oversee personal assistant staff to ensure they provide quality daily hands-on care and supervision of assigned consumers.ssist clients in meeting their individual goals and objectives as defined in their Individual Habilitation Plan.
* Demonstrate a basic understanding of medications, purpose and side effects.
* Demonstrate proper body mechanics and mobility transfer technique to prevent injuries.
* De-escalate potential crisis situations and if necessary be prepared to control client physically.
* To assist the Regional Director in the development, updating and implementation of the Individual Habilitation Plans and Essential Life Plans.
* To assist the Regional Director in the coordination and management of Consumer’s case; to serve as a liaison between school, home and community.

**Job Requirements:**

* Valid Driver's License
* High School Diploma or GED + 3 years DDD relevant experience and/or personal knowledge of developmental disabilities
* OR Bachelor’s degree in psychology, social work or related field + 1 year of DDD relevant experience and/or personal knowledge of developmental disabilities

* Potential public service loan forgiveness

title: Full Time Nanny
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and upbeat nanny to join a wonderful family with two young children: a 1-year-old and a 1-month-old. The ideal candidate will have the stamina and enthusiasm to keep up with the demands of caring for two small children and will be comfortable working in a loving, busy household.

**MUST LOVE DOGS AND CAN DRIVE.**

**Hourly Rate:** $30 - $35

**Schedule:**

* Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:30 PM

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide attentive and nurturing care to a 1-year-old and a 1-month-old.
* Engage children in age-appropriate activities and developmental play.
* Prepare and serve meals and snacks.
* Handle light household duties related to the children, such as laundry and tidying up.
* Ensure the safety and well-being of the children at all times.
* Manage the daily routine, including naps and outings.

* Strong communicators.

With Grace values their nannies and strives to match them with fulfilling and rewarding placements. Our goal is to help you find a job you love, that matches your specialties, experience, and personality with a loving family in need of your expertise.

title: Bilingual School Based Clinician
description:
Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

**Job Details:** Family Services of Westchester is looking for full-time Bilingual School-Based Clinician for our Webutuck School District's Family Mental Health Program.

**Position:** Bilingual School- Based Clinician

**Salary:** $60,000 - $68,000.

**Status**: Full Time

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provide individual, family, and group counseling based on clinical diagnosis and assessment of the clients' presenting problems within the school based satellite clinic.
* Accurately document all clinical interventions, diagnoses, symptoms, and presenting problems in the Electronic Medical Record
* Provide high-quality evidence-based treatment using a variety of modalities including trauma systems therapy and substance use disorder interventions.
* Participate in weekly supervision, multi-disciplinary team meetings, service training programs.
* Provide crisis counseling, linkages to concrete and wraparound service, and coordinate with other providers to better serve the needs of students and families.
* Bilingual Spanish/English

***EDUCATION:***

* Master's Degree from an accredited graduate school in Social Work, Mental Health
* Counseling, or Marriage and Family Therapy (MSW, MHC, or MFT)
* LMSW, LMHC, or LMFT preferred with current New York State registration and license as a Licensed
* Master of Social Work (LMSW) or corresponding degree.

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please apply through Indeed.com. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

FSW is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Automotive Master Technician
description:
**Make more money and work less hours - get paid by the hour with unlimited upside!**  
We are looking for an experienced Master Technician for one of our highest volume shops. It is run by an experienced manager who can sell your work.  
It's all about production - find the work and get it done to tap into an unlimited and lucrative commission program.  
In addition to getting a percentage of all the service you do, you get $5 for every tire and $10 for every battery.  
Here's how it works:  
$10,000 in service = $1,400 + tire and battery payout  
$11,000 in service = $1,540 + tire and battery payout  
$13,000 in service = $1,820 + tire and battery payout  
$15,000 in service = $2,100 + tire and battery payout  
$17,000 in service = $2,380 + tire and battery payout  
$20,000 in service = $2,800 + tire and battery payout

This includes all dollars from every brake job, engine diagnostic, alignment, shock/strut, etc.

title: Post-Doctoral Associate
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Post-Doctoral Associate
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** RWJ - Brain Health Institute
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers The State University is seeking a Post-Doctoral Fellow in the Brain Health Institute of Robert Wood Johnson Medical School.  

  

The incumbent will work as a post-doctoral fellow in the laboratory of the Brain Health Institute on a project dedicated to investigating the roles of macrophages and fractalkine signaling in noise-or age-related hearing loss, cochlear synaptopathy and neuropathy. The research involves using genetic mouse models, breeding, weaning, and genotyping, auditory function assessment, tissue harvesting and microdissection, organ culture, immunohistochemistry, confocal imaging of fixed and live tissue, flow cytometry, cell sorting, sequencing, bioinformatics, inner-ear delivery, gene or peptide therapy, basic cellular and molecular biology. The incumbent will possess an excellent record of research achievements and expertise in one of the following areas: Inner ear biology, auditory neuroscience, systems physiology, electrophysiology, and cellular, molecular, and computational neuroscience. Opportunities are available to present scientific data at local, national, and international meetings and grant writing mentorship for independent positions.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Perform research that will involve managing various mouse colonies, noise exposures, hearing function testing, isolation and microdissections of tissues, multi-label immunohistochemistry, advanced imaging of fixed and live tissue, cellular and molecular biology techniques, cell, and tissue culturing, proteomics, bioinformatics, inner ear delivery of small molecules, genes, or peptides.
* Maintain accurate records of individual experimentation and research.
* Analyze, organize, and present data at laboratory meetings and major scientific meetings.
* Write and submit abstracts for scientific meetings.
* Write and submit manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
* Mentor and train undergraduate and graduate trainees in the lab.
* Plan monthly one-on-one meeting with the PI and participate in lab meetings and other seminars.

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day

* Peer-reviewed publications, excellent training in one of the following areas: Inner ear biology, auditory neuroscience, systems physiology, electrophysiology, and cellular, molecular, and computational neuroscience.

title: Obesity Prevention Instructor
description:
Are you passionate about enriching the lives of youth? Join the NYEG team!

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

NYEG is a division of the FSG holding group and is the largest and leading Health, Wellness, Nutritional and Educational management group for all nonprofit social service agencies in the TRI State and nationally. NYEG’s reach extends to over 500 different programs and all the work we do is revolved around improving health and quality of life through the integration of all the services and programs we offer.

Please visit our website, nyenrichmentgroup.com,to review our offerings.

JOB DESCRIPTION

NY Enrichment Group is seeking several reliable, self-motivated, and enthusiastic Obesity Prevention Instructors to join our team. These instructors will design, plan, and lead fitness programs specifically tailored for seniors. The ideal candidates will create engaging opportunities that promote physical activity, safety, and respect while supporting the development of leadership and healthy lifestyle habits among participants. Candidates must demonstrate a high degree of professionalism, a strong commitment to the communities we serve, and the ability to motivate, inspire, and educate.

**Duties Include:**

* Leading fitness activities and programs focused on obesity prevention for seniors.
* Developing and implementing curriculum and lesson plans for each session.
* Facilitating classes that encourage social interaction and group support.
* Managing a class of 10-15 seniors effectively.
* Preparing for classes by arriving 15 minutes early to set up and ensuring classes start on time.
* Cleaning up after classes, leaving locations in their original or better condition.
* Building and maintaining positive relationships with staff, participants, and their families.
* Providing follow-up with the NYEG Director of Operations after classes.
* Maintaining a positive, healthy, safe, supportive, and welcoming environment.

**Requirements:**

* Candidates must be highly responsible, reliable, punctual, flexible, and possess strong integrity. This role involves working independently with minimal supervision.
* Candidates should be comfortable working with seniors and leading a class independently.
* Clear communication, a positive attitude, and effective classroom management are essential.
* Relevant experience in fitness instruction or obesity prevention is preferred.

Schedule & Location:

* Friday
* **October 18th & November 22nd**
* **11:30am-12:30pm**
* Brooklyn, NY

Additional programming opportunities may be available to the successful candidate.

*This is a freelance/independent contractor position.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $70.00 - $90.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

**SUMMARY:**

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

Reporting to the Manager of Accounting, under close supervision, the Assistant Bookkeeper ‘B’ will be responsible for but not limited to:

* Process Split-Off reports (journal and transfer funds to various accounts)
* Reconcile benefit contributions yearly with IT department for external auditors
* Process EESISP wrap and Contractor Refund
* Maintain monthly contribution schedule for various funds
* Maintain Target Fund withdrawals/ check writing
* Set up stipulations
* Process no monies payroll
* Process Benefit Replacement checks write off
* Print Benefit Replacement checks weekly
* Print Accounts Payable checks weekly
* Upload journals into the accounting software
* Process voids and reissues for multiple funds
* Will serve as a back-up on other functions in the department as necessary
* Handle special projects as assigned by the Accounting Manager

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
The role of a Skechers Product Specialist is to provide an excellent customer experience. Product Specialists are enthusiastic and welcoming, they serve as Skechers product experts and are committed to customer satisfaction.***Compensation Information***

***Starting Rate: $17.00***

***Range is: $16.50******- $17.50***

**Main Responsibilities**

* Drive sales through excellent customer service.
* Act as a product expert and serve as a brand ambassador for all things Skechers, using this knowledge to guide customers to the right product selection.
* Continuously ensuring floor inventory is well maintained, merchandising, stocking and cleaning – whatever it takes to create a premier shopping experience for the customer.
* Efficiently process customer transactions, discounts, etc. at the point of sale. Accepts returns professionally and encourages exchanges or alternatives where possible, striving to always maintain the customer relationship.
* Stays up to date on the latest Skechers’ product knowledge.

**Skills, Qualifications and Experience**

* Loves being a part of the team and treats every coworker with respect and positivity.
* Previous retail, restaurant, or hospitality experience preferred but not required.
* Work availability should be open to the store’s needs.
* Flexible and motivated to provide excellent customer service.
* Strong attention to detail.

**About Skechers**  

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories. Developing comfort technologies is the foundation of all we do – delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products. Serving over 180 countries and territories, Skechers connects customers to products through department and specialty stores, e-commerce and digital stores, and through our more than 5,200 company-and third-party-owned retail locations. Headquartered in Southern California, with offices and distribution centers around the globe, Skechers has spent 30 years helping people of all ages look and feel good.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**  

Skechers is committed to providing a safe, inclusive, and respectful work environment. Skechers provides equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants for employment without regard race, color, religion, gender, gender identification and expression, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, military status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic established by local, state or federal law.
